channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The litter bin on this corner is missing, 15th January
item.description:
This bin was removed on Monday - we assume by the council. (It had been tipped over and maybe damaged.) Everyone on the street is hoping the council will replace it as it was well used and was the ONLY one in the vicinity. Without it, there will be much more litter on the street, especially around the old Manor Place Baths.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penton Place, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Serco bags, 15th January
item.description:
Literally every street around here is lined with these Serco litter bags. They get left to be picked up and never are. People dump rubbish on them. Foxes tear them apart. When are they meant to be picked up? Why are we meant to live with streets that the council’s own rubbish contractor dumps rubbish on? What is the rationale here?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Alexandra Drive, West Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole park is full of litter, 15th January
item.description:
Council spent a lot of £ on extending this park and everyday I pick up at least 2 bags of litter Can you please send a regular litter removal to the park please Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sturdy Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rough sleeping and mess AGAIN, 15th January
item.description:
Someone is sleeping outside whole foods again with a trolley full of stuff and surrounded by litter and bottles of urine. This gets reported, cleaned up and then they return. Something needs to be done about this more long term. It’s getting ridiculous.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing warning sign on raised area in road., 15th January
item.description:
The speed restriction measures outside the school is missing the warning sign which seems to be lying to the left of the refuge area that drivers need to drive around. It is very dangerous at night as it is difficult to see without the bright yellow sign. Need urgent attention.

Report on FixMyStreet
